conclusion: The liquid is released from points A, B, and C.
The liquid from A flows downward and is guided by an orange bar.
The liquid from A encounters a red bar and flows to the left.
The liquid from A continues to flow downward, bypassing the brown bar, and heads towards container D.
The liquid from B flows downward and is guided by a yellow bar.
The liquid from B encounters a red bar and flows to the right.
The liquid from B continues downward past a gray bar, heading towards container E.
The liquid from C flows downward and is guided by an orange bar.
The liquid from C encounters a blue bar and flows to the right.
The liquid from C continues downward past a gray bar and heads towards container E.
The liquid from A flows into container D.
The liquids from B and C flow into container E.
The liquid will flow into container D from A and into container E from B and C.
